comment.author: 25453448@N02
comment._content: Architect: Sir Christopher Wren, one of Britain's greatest architects.  He was a graduate of Wadham College, just round the corner, out of sight to the left of this picture. The building to the left of it is the University's Clarendon Building whose architect was Wren's great pupil, Nicholas Hawksmoor.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: The busts of Roman emperors that adorned the fence were still there when I was in Oxford in 1956, but they eventually succumbed to the ravages of acid rain (probably not for the first time). I believe they have been replaced. Maybe we could get Morse on the case?

comment.author: 25453448@N02
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/70251312@N00] The heads are only 'said to be' Roman Emperors.  In fact they are somewhat caricature in style and have also been said to be philosophers or 'worthies'.  The battered old heads were eventually replaced, using Loggan's contemporary print of the Sheldonian Theatre to re-construct their original appearance, since the original head were so far gone as to be unrecognizable.
